title.narrative: Conservation of Ancient and Historic Buddhist Ethnographic Objects in Thimpu and Other Districts

description.narrative: Bhutan's oldest government institution, the Zhung Dratshang, or Central Monastic Body, is custodian of sacred objects of important spiritual, cultural, historical, and sociopolitical value. This project involves the development of a database and digital archive of objects, sculptures, paintings, textiles, and other treasures of Bhutan's 2,000 monasteries, temples, and fortresses.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs
Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

description.narrative: Bhutan is a source and destination country for men, women, and children vulnerable to forced labor and sex trafficking. While the government of Bhutan has stated its commitment to combating human trafficking, it also acknowledged its efforts were hampered by low capacity and awareness of the crime. The goal of this project is to work cooperatively with eight different central government entities and parts of local government to address deficiencies in Bhutanese legislation, to equip police to better investigate trafficking cases, and improve information sharing to target criminals and corrupt leaders and disrupt human trafficking. The project aims to improve the skills and capacity of the Bhutanese government to investigate and prosecute human trafficking. If successful, the project will lead to an increase in investigations and prosecutions of human trafficking, thereby serving as a deterrent to potential traffickers. While the Government of Bhutan does not have formalized diplomatic relations with the United States, it recognizes the leadership of the United States in combating human trafficking and has actively sought to increase direct bilateral partnership on this issue.

title.narrative: Enhance Government and Civil Society Responses to Counter Trafficking in Persons in Bhutan

description.narrative: UNODC will provide technical assistance to the Royal Government of Bhutan in assessing gaps in the legal framework and drafting appropriate legislation in line with international standards. UNODC will conduct multidisciplinary trainings on victim-centered investigations and prosecutions, help establish standard operating procedures for investigating TIP cases, and create opportunities for government and NGO representatives to learn from the TIP experience of more experienced actors. UNODC also will establish and support transit homes for TIP victims, and design and implement a public awareness campaign.

title.narrative: Inventory and Documentation of Cultural Heritage Sites in Bhutan

description.narrative: Bhutan abounds in cultural heritage sites related to the history of the kingdoms royal family and of the arrival of Buddhism. This project, which spans four districts, includes the documentation of nationally important heritage sites and a public awareness and stewardship campaign.

title.narrative: Conservation of the 19th-Century Wangduechhoeling Palace in Bumthang, Phase 2

description.narrative: Built in the 19th century and the original seat of power of Bhutan's ruling dynasty, the palace exemplifies traditional Bhutanese architecture and craftsmanship. This project, which continues work begun under previous AFCP grants, advances the growing U.S.-Bhutan bilateral relationship and fosters critical partnerships between American and Bhutanese institutions and organizations.

title.narrative: Documentation of the 19th-Century Wangduechhoeling Palace in Bumthang

description.narrative: To support the documentation of the Wangduechhoeling Palace in Bumthang, the original seat of power of the ruling dynasty of Bhutan, as the first phase of a larger project to convert the palace to a museum. Built in the 19th century, the palace exemplifies traditional Bhutanese architecture and craftsmanship. This project involves an architectural conservation assessment, emergency interventions, and other activities in preparation for a comprehensive restoration of the building.
